Meets the specific needs of the attending surgeon, often assisting several surgeons in a single practice
Has exacting knowledge of each surgeon's idiosyncrasies to expedite the procedure and limit patient morbidity and mortality
Uses knowledge of medical model to promote synergistic relationship between physician and PA
Has extensive knowledge of ventilator management and artificial cardiac devices
Performs duties of a primary care PA
Manages other disease entities frequently encountered in the cardiac population, namely hypertension, diabetes, COPD, asthma, pneumonia and others

Title: Physician Assistant
Description:
Advanced Urology Institute (AUI) is recognized, both locally and nationally, as an independent organization of urologists which is deeply rooted in our mission of “Advancing Patient-Centered Urologic Care”.

Physician Assistant
Department: AUI Clinical Department
Reports to: Practice Manager
Supervises: None
Overtime Status: Non-Exempt
GENERAL SUMMARY OF DUTIES:
The Physician Assistant provides medical treatment under the supervision of the physicians for Advanced Urology Institute. Conduct patient examinations and follow-ups, provide treatment plans, and counsel patients. May, in some cases, prescribe medication. This medical care will be provided within the frame work of the hospital’s medical staff department’s policies and procedures. Will work with complex surgical patients both pre and post-operatively.
RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO:
Acts as the primary physician extender for the Radiation Oncology Service line.
Provides patient care and dictates patient care rendered per expectations of the Radiation Oncology Service Line.
Obtains and dictates history and physical, progress notes, and discharge summaries to document care given to patient.
Ensures all pertinent data in patient charts are counter-signed by the supervising physician.
Coordinates advanced diagnostic and therapeutic patient care procedures by assisting with the technical and medical aspects of simulation and treatment planning.
Family counseling.
Counsels patients in preventive care.
Review of side effects with patient prior to obtaining consent for radiation therapy treatments.
Assists with management of unscheduled patient visits.
Assists with the management of emergency patient treatments.
Assesses patients for radiation toxicity and other co-morbid conditions and provides symptom management during weekly status checks.
Manages daily patient problems as necessary and documents care implemented.
Provides in-service and daily consultation to nursing staff.
With supervision, conducts inpatient consults to evaluate patients for radiation treatment.
With supervision, coordinates hospice referrals and discharge planning.
Can initiate emergency resuscitation and stabilizing measures.
Administers or orders medication as requested by supervising physician.
Responds to physician patient calls.
Identifies patients for clinical protocols.
Responsible for RTOG studies.
Knowledgeable in protocols and pathways of the Radiation Oncology Service Line.
Coordinates and assists with HDR procedures.
Follow-up with HDR patients and provide symptom management as necessary.
Participates in chart rounds, conferences and meetings as required by the Radiation Oncology Service Line.
May be required to evaluate portal films in view station, determine and draw treatment fields, contour anatomical volumes in Eclipse, or transcribe anatomy from CT to simulation films as appropriate, and dictate external beam summaries.
Completes documentation for charges as required by AUI radiation billing protocol.
Attends all department meetings as required.
Ability to discern when to seek assistance in order to provide quality patient care and meet centers' patient care objectives.
Maintain patient privacy, patient identity, and patient confidentiality and personnel information on current and former staff members. Must be aware of The Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA).
Periodic duties as requested by the supervising physician and allowed by state and federal laws.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:
Knowledge:
Must have at least two (2) years of progressive radiation therapy experience.
1-2 years previous experience in urology preferred
Skills:
Showcase exceptional customer service skills
Adjusting actions in relation to others' actions.
Understanding the implications of new information for both current and future problem-solving and decision-making.
Maintains patient and employee privacy and confidentiality.
Abilities:
Be an exceptional multi-tasker and meet tight deadlines.
Follows all policies and procedures including safety and infection control.
Demonstrates tact, diplomacy and sensitivity in communications.
EDUCATION/CERTIFICATIONS:
Must be licensed or otherwise recognized as a nurse practitioner in the state of Florida, and maintain full and current certification as a nurse practitioner from the American Nurses Association or another nationally recognized certifying body.
Must be a Graduate from a Physician Assistant program approved by the council of Medical Education of the American Medical Association and maintain certification by the National Commission on the Certification of Physician Assistants.
Current Basic Life Support certification (BLS).
Certification by the State of Florida.
WORK ENVIRONMENT:
Normal office environment.
Working with radiation, but little chance of injury or illness when established safety procedures are followed.
Inherent potential for mucous membrane or skin contact with blood, body fluids or tissues, or a potential for spills or splashes during the performance of a job - use of standards precautions and personal protective equipment required for performing tasks likely to cause exposure.
Work hours can be long and without a break for eating or resting depending upon patient needs.
Most work performed standing.
Excellent attendance is an expectation.
Walking to and from inpatient units and various departments.
May be required to dictate letters to referring physicians by keying Medical Records dictation number and codes into telephone/ computer keyboard and speaking into a hand held telephone receiver or voice activated computer system.
MENTAL/PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
Hearing: Adequate to perform job duties in person and over the telephone. Able to use
Stethoscope and respond to verbal questions.
Speaking: Must be able to communicate clearly to patients in person and over the telephone.
Vision: Visual acuity adequate to perform job duties, including visual examination of patient and reading information from printed sources and computer screens.
AUI is the fifth largest, and expanding, urology practice in the United States. AUI offers competitive benefits that include a retirement plan, medical, dental, vision and life insurance.
